page.title: 19HOUSING IN THE AREA
page.content: LINCOLN PARK. It has about 130 houses and is a private estate built in the late 60s. There are both detached and terraced houses. Many of the detached have been extended or have had double glazing fitted. Three closes, Canterbury, Ely and York, lead off Lincoln Park. There are two greens, both used as unofficial playing areas. It is within easy walking distance of schools and of the town centre. STANLEY HILL.The housing is mainly semi-detached, with one row of terraced houses. Although most were built in the 30s, some are modern. Some have mock-Tudor timbering and most have porches and metal-framed windows. Some have extensions and new roofs.Brudenell Girls' Secondary School and St. George's First School are on Stanley Hill as well as a cemetery next to a private beechwood.
